intro: Arthrosia longicaulis, commonly known as the long-stemmed arthrosia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach heights of up to 2 meters. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stem. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough, hairy texture. Arthrosia longicaulis is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species in temperate climates.
